verses.verse: (Num. 24:6; Ps. 52:8; Jer. 17:8; Hos. 14:5, 6) The righteous shall flourish like a palm tree, He shall grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
Those who are planted in the house of the LORD Shall flourish in the courts of our God.
They shall still bear fruit in old age; They shall be fresh and flourishing,
To declare that the LORD is upright; ((Deut. 32:4)) He is my rock, and ((Rom. 9:14)) there is no unrighteousness in Him.

The Eternal Reign of the LORD The (Ps. 96:10) LORD reigns, He is clothed with majesty; The LORD is clothed, (Ps. 65:6) He has girded Himself with strength. Surely the world is established, so that it cannot be moved.
(Ps. 45:6; (Lam. 5:19)) Your throne is established from of old; You are from everlasting.
The floods have lifted up, O LORD, The floods have lifted up their voice; The floods lift up their waves.
(Ps. 65:7) The LORD on high is mightier Than the noise of many waters, Than the mighty waves of the sea.
Your testimonies are very sure; Holiness adorns Your house, O LORD, forever.
God the Refuge of the Righteous O LORD God, (Deut. 32:35; (Is. 35:4; Nah. 1:2; Rom. 12:19)) to whom vengeance belongs— O God, to whom vengeance belongs, shine forth!
Rise up, O ((Gen. 18:25)) Judge of the earth; Render punishment to the proud.
LORD, ((Job 20:5)) how long will the wicked, How long will the wicked triumph?
They (Ps. 31:18; Jude 15) utter speech, and speak insolent things; All the workers of iniquity boast in themselves.
They break in pieces Your people, O LORD, And afflict Your heritage.
They slay the widow and the stranger, And murder the fatherless.
(Job 22:13; Ps. 10:11) Yet they say, “The LORD does not see, Nor does the God of Jacob understand.”
Understand, you senseless among the people; And you fools, when will you be wise?
((Ex. 4:11; Prov. 20:12)) He who planted the ear, shall He not hear? He who formed the eye, shall He not see?
He who instructs the nations, shall He not correct, He who teaches man knowledge?
The LORD (Job 11:11; 1 Cor. 3:20) knows the thoughts of man, That they are futile.
Blessed is the man whom You ((Deut. 8:5; Job 5:17; Ps. 119:71; Prov. 3:11, 12; Heb. 12:5, 6)) instruct, O LORD, And teach out of Your law,
That You may give him rest from the days of adversity, Until the pit is dug for the wicked.
For the LORD will not cast off His people, Nor will He forsake His inheritance.
